intro: Ouratea engama, commonly known as the Engama tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
